net.viktorc.pp4j.impl

Class JavaProcessPoolExecutor

  • Object
    • ProcessPoolExecutor
      • JavaProcessPoolExecutor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor, ExecutorService, JavaProcessExecutorService, ProcessExecutor, ProcessExecutorService

    public class JavaProcessPoolExecutor
extends ProcessPoolExecutor
implements JavaProcessExecutorService
    A sub-class of ProcessPoolExecutor that implements the JavaProcessExecutorService interface. It uses Java processes for the implementation of multiprocessing. It communicates with the processes via their standard streams exchanging serialized and encoded objects. It can send Runnable and Callable instances to the processes; and it receives the result or exception object serialized and encoded into a string.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

    • Constructor Detail

      • JavaProcessPoolExecutor

        public JavaProcessPoolExecutor(JavaProcessOptions options,
                               int minPoolSize,
                               int maxPoolSize,
                               int reserveSize,
                               T startupTask,
                               boolean verbose)
                        throws InterruptedException
        Constructs a Java process pool executor using the specified parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the startup task.
        Parameters:
        options - The options for the "java" program used to create the new JVM.
        minPoolSize - The minimum size of the process pool.
        maxPoolSize - The maximum size of the process pool.
        reserveSize - The number of available processes to keep in the pool.
        startupTask - The task to execute in each process on startup, before the process starts accepting submissions. If it is null, no taks are executed on startup.
        verbose - Whether the events related to the management of the process pool should be logged. Setting this parameter to true does not guarantee that logging will be performed as logging depends on the SLF4J binding and the logging configurations, but setting it to false guarantees that no logging will be performed by the constructed instance.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while it is waiting for the core threads to start up.
        IllegalArgumentException - If options is null, the minimum pool size is less than 0, or the maximum pool size is less than the minimum pool size or 1, or the reserve size is less than 0 or greater than the maximum pool size.

    • Method Detail

      • getJavaProcessOptions

        public JavaProcessOptions getJavaProcessOptions()
        Returns the Java process options associated with the pool.
        Returns:
        The Java process options used to create the processes.

      • submitExplicitly

        public <T extends Serializable,S extends Callable<T> & Serializable> Future<T> submitExplicitly(S task,
                                                                                                boolean terminateProcessAfterwards)
                                                                                         throws IOException
        It executes a serializable Callable instance with a serializable return type in one of the processes of the pool and returns its return value. If the implementation contains non-serializable, non-transient fields, or the return type is not serializable, the method fails.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The serializable return type variable of the Callable
        S - A serializable Callable instance with the return type T.
        Parameters:
        task - The runnablePart to execute.
        terminateProcessAfterwards - Whether the process that executes the runnablePart should be terminated afterwards.
        Returns:
        A Future instance associated with the return value of the runnablePart.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the serialization fails.
        NotSerializableException - If some object to be serialized does not implement the Serializable interface.

      • submit

        public <T> Future<T> submit(Callable<T> task,
                            boolean terminateProcessAfterwards)
        Description copied from interface: JavaProcessExecutorService
        See JavaProcessExecutorService.submit(Callable).
        Specified by:
        submit in interface JavaProcessExecutorService
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the result.
        Parameters:
        task - The task to execute.
        terminateProcessAfterwards - Whether the process is to be terminated after the execution of the task.
        Returns:
        A Future instance to allow for waiting for the task to be executed, to cancel it, or to retrieve the value of the result of the operation.

      • shutdownNow

        public List<Runnable> shutdownNow()
        See ExecutorService.shutdownNow(). It is equivalent to ProcessPoolExecutor.forceShutdown() with the only difference being that this method filters and converts the returned submissions to a list of Runnable instances excluding Callable based submissions.
        Specified by:
        shutdownNow in interface ExecutorService
